title: A Phase 1, Safety, Tolerability, Single-ascending Dose, Multiple-ascending Dose, Food Effect, and Pharmacokinetic Study of TML-6 in Healthy Volunteers
description_brief: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety, tolerability, single-ascending dose (SAD), multiple-ascending dose (MAD), food effect, and pharmacokinetic (PK) Study of TML-6.
drug: TML-6 (synthetic curcumin analog, also referenced as ASC-6)
explanation_target: Reason: The trial title and description indicate a Phase 1 SAD/MAD/PK study of TML-6 in healthy volunteers (early safety/pharmacokinetics). Independent sources describe TML-6 as a synthetic curcumin analog and an oral small molecule with multi‑target actions relevant to Alzheimer’s pathology — autolysosome/autophagy activation, Nrf2 (anti‑oxidative) activation, anti‑amyloid effects (β‑amyloid reduction/clearance), and anti‑inflammatory (NF‑κB inhibition). citeturn0search3turn0search0

Act: Extracted key details — drug name TML-6 (ASC‑6), drug type = small molecule/curcumin analog, intended effects = reduce amyloid accumulation and modulate aging/autophagy pathways (disease‑modifying mechanisms). Clinical history/supporting documents report IND approval and initiation of a Phase 1 trial and subsequent Phase 2 planning based on Phase 1 safety/PK findings. citeturn0search7turn0search1

Reflect: Given the drug is a small molecule designed to target Alzheimer’s pathology (amyloid, autophagy/lysosomal pathway, oxidative/inflammatory pathways), it matches the definition of a "disease‑targeted small molecule" rather than a biologic, purely symptomatic cognitive enhancer, or a neuropsychiatric‑symptoms treatment. Preclinical and early clinical summaries support disease‑targeting intent. (Example preclinical efficacy and combination studies in AD mouse models also show Aβ reduction with TML‑6.) citeturn0search6turn0search3
Web search results used: PR Newswire/press releases reporting IND approval and Phase 1/Phase 2 plans for TML‑6 (Merry Life/MLB). citeturn0search7turn0search0

PubMed publications describing TML‑6 as a curcumin analog with multi‑targeted mechanisms (autophagy activation, Nrf2 activation, reduction of Aβ; used in AD animal models). citeturn0search3turn0search6
explanation_agent: Reason: The investigational drug TML-6 (aka ASC‑6) is described in the literature and company releases as a synthetic curcumin analog with multiple disease‑modifying mechanisms relevant to AD — activation of Nrf2 (antioxidant), inhibition of mTOR with autophagy/autolysosome activation (proteostasis), reduction of Aβ/APP production and enhancement of Aβ clearance (amyloid pathway), suppression of NF‑κB (anti‑inflammatory), and upregulation of ApoE. These multi‑pathway actions are reported in preclinical publications and company trial announcements, indicating the intervention targets several CADRO categories simultaneously (amyloid, inflammation, oxidative stress, proteostasis, ApoE). citeturn1search3turn1search5

Act: Extracted key details — drug name: TML‑6 (ASC‑6); drug type: oral small molecule / synthetic curcumin analog; reported mechanisms: Nrf2 activation (oxidative stress), mTOR inhibition/autophagy activation (proteostasis/proteinopathies), reduction of Aβ and APP (amyloid), NF‑κB inhibition (inflammation), ApoE upregulation (lipid/ApoE pathway). Because the described mechanisms span multiple CADRO categories rather than a single specific target, I assign: R) Multi-target. Supporting sources: the preclinical PubMed/PMC article and combination/efficacy study, and company press releases describing IND/Phase 1 and Phase 2 plans. citeturn1search3turn1search1turn0search3turn0search0

Reflect: The multi‑mechanistic profile described in peer‑reviewed preclinical studies (improved behavior, reduced Aβ, Nrf2/mTOR/NF‑κB/ApoE effects) plus company statements about multi‑target strategy and clinical progression justify the 'Multi‑target' CADRO classification rather than assigning a single pathway category (e.g., only Amyloid or only Inflammation). If future trial materials specify a single dominant molecular target, reclassification could be considered, but based on current evidence the most specific correct CADRO label is R) Multi‑target. citeturn1search3turn0search0

Web search results cited (selected): (1) Preclinical peer‑reviewed study showing TML‑6 biological effects (Nrf2, mTOR/autophagy, APP/Aβ suppression, ApoE upregulation) and efficacy in AD mouse models. citeturn1search3 (2) Combination study showing additive effects of anti‑Aβ antibody plus TML‑6 in APP/PS1 mice (reduced Aβ, improved behavior, enhanced microglial phagocytosis). citeturn1search1 (3) PR Newswire: IND approval and Phase 1 SAD/MAD/PK study initiation (company announcement). citeturn0search3 (4) PR Newswire / company release announcing Phase II development and describing multi‑mechanistic/autolysosome focus. citeturn0search0 (5) MDPI / review of mechanistic implications from preclinical data. citeturn1search5
